info.title: Jumio Platform API - Retrieval
info.description:
Retrieval requests let you determine the status of workflow execution. After workflow completion, you can make requests to fetch the results of workflow execution, including risk scores, decisions, and details about the services executed.

To check workflow status, you can poll the end-points periodically or set up a callback and Jumio will send a webhook to your specified URL when a workflow execution completes. All requests require a JWT for authentication.

Related guide: Viewing or Retrieving Workflow Transactions

servers.description: Root URL for the US datacenter
Root URL for the EU datacenter
Root URL for the SGP datacenter

tags.name: Deletion
tags.description: Delete specific credentials or their parts.

tags.name: Feedback
tags.description:
After Jumio has processed a transaction, you can provide feedback on the decision automatically assigned by the workflow.
See also: Providing Feedback

delete.description: Deletes all PII data in every workflow-execution.

204.description: All PII in workflow-execution for the account is already deleted.

get.description:
Returns the binary of the credential part specified in the classifier. JPEG or PNG image (max. size 5 MB and max resolution of 8000 x 8000)
See credential reference for more about credentials and their parts.

parameters.name: classifier
parameters.description:
The credential part to return.
VALUES: FRONT, BACK, FACE

get.description: Returns the detailed results of workflow execution as a transaction record.

delete.description: Deletes all the PII data from the specified workflow execution.

202.description: Request accepted, all PII data is deleted.

get.description:
Returns the same workflow status response as that sent by the callback.
See viewing or retrieving workflows for more information.

get.summary: Fetch a presigned URL that can be used to download a PDF of transaction

get.description: Returns the steps in the workflow execution. Each step is a single service that executes one or more capabilities. See the service and workflows reference for more information.
Returns the rules in the workflow execution.

put.summary: Provide feedback on whether or not the transaction was fraudulent.

status.description:
Status of workflow.
VALUES: NOT_EXECUTED, PASSED, REJECTED, WARNING

definitionKey.description: Definition of workflow. Note that this refers to the static definition of the workflow rather than an instance of execution.

reportingCriteria.description: Additional information provided by a customer for searching and aggregation purposes. The customer define any string they want for each workflow.

credentials.description: See the credential reference for more information about different types of credential.

capabilities.description: Capabilities list. See the capabilities reference for more information about different types of capabilities. Also see Risk Signals for additional available services.

category.description:
Type of credential.
VALUES: ID, SELFIE, FACEMAP, DATA, DOCUMENT

clientIp.description: IP address credential was uploaded from.

href.description: URL to access binary of the part.

captureType.description: How the image was captured from the end user device.

id.description: Unique id of the capability used in the step.

category.description:
Type of capability used in the step.
VALUES: Usability, ImageCheck, Extraction, DataChecks, Liveness, Similarity, Authentication, WatchlistScreening, RiskSignals

credentials.description: Array of credentials used in workflow.

type.description: Document type. VALUES: PASSPORT, DRIVING_LICENSE, ID_CARD, VISA, UNSUPPORTED.

issuingCountry.description: The country that issued the document. Can be any ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, and XKX for Kosovo

firstName.description: First name of the id subject.

lastName.description: Last name of the id subject.

dateOfBirth.description: Birth date of the id subject.

issuingDate.description: Date the identifying document was issued to the holder.

socialSecurityNumber.description: Social Security number for US citizens.

signatureAvailable.description: True if the holder's signature is available on SSN card. False if not (only applies to SSN cards in USA).

state.description:
State of jurisdiction within country. Possible values:
- Last two characters of ISO 3166-2:US state code
- Last 2-3 characters of ISO 3166-2:AU state code
- Last two characters of ISO 3166-2:CA state code
- ISO 3166-1 country name - XKX (Kosovo)
- Free text if it can't be mapped to a state/country code

personalNumber.description: Personal number if appropriate to the document.

optionalMrzField1.description: Optional field of MRZ line 1, from the bottom of a visa, passport, and some Id documents.

optionalMrzField2.description: Optional field of MRZ line 2, from the bottom of a visa, passport, and some Id documents.

issuingAuthority.description: Name of the authority that issued the document.

issuingPlace.description: Place the document was issued to the holder.

curp.description: The national ID Number (CURP) for Mexican id holders. An 18-character alphanumeric code.

gender.description:
Gender of the id holder as indicated on the document.
- M
- F
- X

nationality.description: Nationality of the document holder in ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code or country specific non ISO nationalities (3 letters)

placeOfBirth.description: Place of birth of the id holder.

taxNumber.description: Tax number of the document if country doe is ITA AND type is HEALTH_ID or TAX_ID.

cpf.description: Tax ID issued by the Brazilian Revenue - CPF (Cadastro de Pessoas FÃ­sicas).

registrationNumber.description: Registration number if used on the ID.

mothersName.description: Name of Id subjects mother (typically Brazilian ID only). More information

fathersName.description: Name of Id subject's father (typically Brazilian ID only). More information

personalIdentificationNumber.description: Personal id number on the document.

rgNumber.description: Number on Brazilian national identification document.

voterIdNumber.description: \"Clave de elector\" number for idCountry = MEX (if extraction is enabled).

issuingNumber.description: \"Numero de emission\" number for idCountry = MEX (if extraction is enabled).

passportNumber.description: Passport number either for documents with VISA idType or passport number on non-VISA documents (if passport number extraction of non-VISA documents is enabled).

durationOfStay.description: Duration of stay if idType = VISA and additional extraction for Visa enabled.

numberOfEntries.description: Number of entries if idType = VISA and additional extraction for Visa enabled.

visaCategory.description: Visa category if idType = VISA and additional extraction for Visa is enabled.

dni.description: DNI as available on the ID if idCountry = ESP and idSubtype = NATIONAL_ID.

residentPermitType.description: Permit type related to "Golden Visas" (if extraction is enabled).

residentPermitRemarks.description: Permit remarks related to "Golden Visas" (if extraction is enabled)

documentIdentificationNumber.description: Document identification number (if extraction is enabled).

workPermitNumber.description: Work permit number (if extraction is enabled).

laborIdentificationNumber.description: Labor identification number (if extraction is enabled)

lastNameAtBirth.description: Last name at birth (if extraction is enabled).

dlEndorsements.description: Driving license endorsements (if extraction is enabled)

residentPermitNumber.description: Resident permit number (if extraction is enabled)

panNumber.description: PAN number in case of CC document type (Can be masked as well).

monthYearExpiry.description: Credit card expiry date in format MM/YY.

cardNumberLastFourDigits.description: Last 4 digits of credit card number for CCS document type.

currentAge.description: Current age, calculated from date of birth or the date of birth parts field (if currentAge calculation is enabled).

additionalLanguage.description: extraction in document's original language if available and if enabled

line1.description: Line 1 of address on id document, etc.

category.description: Valid categories are based on jurisdiction.

issueDate.description: Date driving license was issued in yyyy-MM-dd format.

expiryDate.description: Date driving license expires in yyyy-MM-dd format.

isReadable.description: False or No if license is unreadable. Otherwise not returned

similarity.description:
Comparison between ID photo and selfie.
VALUES: 'MATCH', 'NO_MATCH', 'NOT_POSSIBLE'.

predictedAge.description: estimation based on AI driven image analysis of selfie provided by the user. Use predictedAge to compare with the extracted date of birth and make decisions in your business logic.

ageConfidenceRange.description: Age range Jumio AI model is confident that selfie indicates.

credentials.description: Array of credentials used in workflow.

imageChecksCapabilityResponse.description: Photo id image analysis. Guide to image check capability.

findings.description: A face (on the ID or Selfie) is matching with another face (on the ID or Selfie) from a previous transaction.

dataChecksCapabilityResponse.description: Data checks. Guide to data checks capability.

watchlistScreeningCapabilityResponse.description: Watchlist screening. Guide to watchlist screening capability.

addressValidationCapabilityResponse.description: Address validation is part of address services. See: Address Services.

proofOfResidencyCapabilityResponse.description: Proof of residency is part of Address Services..

emailVerificationStatus.description:
Shows the status of email verification.
Available values: GeneralError, Certified, Verified, EmailInexistent, ValidDomain, DomainInexistent

phoneType.description: Shows the phone type. Available values are given in the examples. VALUES: fixed line, invalid, mobile, other, pager, payphone, personal, prepaid, tollfree, voip

watchlistVerificationStatus.description:
Shows the status of watchlist verification. Available values are given in the examples.
VALUES: false_positive, potential_match, true_positive, unknown, true_positive_approve, true_positive_reject

items.description: Name of KYB capability available to run on.

highIssuerIdVelocity.description: high no. of Issuer ID(credit cards, prepaid cards etc) are seen with the IP address

highRiskDevicesActivity.description: high risk devices are seen on this IP address

highRiskEmailsActivity.description: high risk emails are seen on this IP address

highRiskNetworkActivity.description: high risk actors are seen on this IP addres

userType.description: specifies the behaviour observed with typical users.

addressMatch.description: Tells whether address matches or not

nameMatchToSsn.description: Tells whether Name matches to SSN or not

phoneMatch.description: Tells whether Phone match or not

ssnMatch.description: Tells whether social Security number match or not

dateOfBirthMatch.description: Tells whether date of birth match or not

isDeceased.description: Tells whether person is alive or not

isSSNIssuedPriorYOB.description: Tells whether issue date of SSN is before year of birth.

riskLevel.description: risk level, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH, UNKNOWN

type.description:
The decision rendered for the capability or workflow step that wraps this object. Use the 'label' property to get context and detail.
VALUES: NOT_EXECUTED, PASSED, REJECTED, WARNING

label.description: Additional detail for context. Valid values vary, depending on the capability.

score.description: Numeric score from -1 to 100. Highest risk is 100.

decision.description: The decision rendered for this step. The 'type' field in the decision object indicates one of: NOT_EXECUTED, PASSED,  REJECTED, WARNING

type.description: The decision rendered for the capability or workflow step that wraps this object. VALUES: NOT_EXECUTED, PASSED, REJECTED, WARNING

title.description:
A short summary of the problem type. Written in plain english and readable
for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and
not localized); example: Service Unavailable

status.description:
The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence
of the problem.

detail.description:
A human readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the
problem.

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

obtained.description:
Values:
'yes' - user's consent was obtained. 
'no' - user's consent was not obtained. 
'na' - not applicable to the transaction.

status.description: Allowed values are NA, FRAUD, NOT_FRAUD

reason.description: Reason for altering the status. Allowed values are NOT_AVAILABLE, ACCOUNT_TAKEOVER, COMPANY_POLICY, FIRST_PARTY_FRAUD, GOVERNMENT_REGULATIONS, IDENTITY_FRAUD, INSIDER_FRAUD, MONEY_LAUNDERING, PAYMENT_FRAUD, PHISHING, SYNTHETIC_ID_FRAUD, THIRD_PARTY_FRAUD

status.description: Allowed values are NA, FRAUD, NOT_FRAUD

reason.description: Reason for altering the status. Allowed values are NOT_AVAILABLE, ACCOUNT_TAKEOVER, COMPANY_POLICY, FIRST_PARTY_FRAUD, GOVERNMENT_REGULATIONS, IDENTITY_FRAUD, INSIDER_FRAUD, MONEY_LAUNDERING, PAYMENT_FRAUD, PHISHING, SYNTHETIC_ID_FRAUD, THIRD_PARTY_FRAUD

example.title: Not found
example.detail: The requested resource could not be found

example.title: Forbidden
example.detail: The provided credentials are not allowed to access the request resource
